definition[0]: cold air that moves through a room and that you can feel
example[0]: Can you close the window? I’m in a draught.
definition[1]: a game played by two people, each with 12 round pieces, on a board of 64 squares
definition[2]: one of the round pieces used in the game of draughts
definition[4]: the depth of water needed by a ship so that it will not touch the bottom of the sea, a river etc
definition[5]: the act of swallowing liquid, or the amount of liquid swallowed at one time
example[2]: Mick took a long draught of lager.
definition[6]: draught beer is served from a large container rather than a bottle
definition[7]: a draught animal is used for pulling heavy loads
definition[8]: a ship’s draught is the distance from the bottom of the ship to the level of the water. This distance is the depth of water that a ship needs to float
